ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I became proficient in MATLAB and learned about the general etiquettes of scientific writing, as well as certain lab procedures.
I became more confident with techniques used in a lab and more comfortable using matlab for data analysis.
I learned about fundamental lab practices and research methods as well as methods for analyzing data and reading academic literature.
Learned about various basics of experiments, coding, as well as the summer research process.
I learned the basics of research techniques, how to code using Matlab and how to reach out to a PI in terms of summer research.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was a very good introduction to programming. However, the class was cross listed in many sciences, but it was actually extremely bio focused, so I think this could be more clear.
I think the overall scheduling of the course allowed us to learn every concept step by step.

The course was done relatively well especially for being experiment based during a time where everything is virtual. The help offered was great, but the coding aspect of the course could have used a little more explaining.

Strengths: This class had lessons about the small parts of student life that gave us the most anxiety: writing emails or writing a proposal because there is no clear guideline of how to write one. 
Weaknesses: MatLab assignments were too complicated at times.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think they succeeded as much as they could by doing live lectures in the lab during lab sections. They also made use of breakout rooms.

The lab sessions were one of our professors performed lab tasks with a camera to let us see what she was doing. Even though it was the best we could have during a pandemic I believe that having that experience in-person would have been more beneficial.
Virtual labs helped!!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. I thought this course was great, even in a virtual format. I would recommend any first year who is unsure about research opportunities to apply for this course.
I would recommend it to anyone new to research settings with an interest in biology.
I would definitely recommend this course to students who want to get a general but very helpful introduction to research in STEM.
Yes, especially if this student is looking to learn more about experimentation and summer research. Perfect class for students who need guiding.
Yes! Especially if anxious about finding a mentor for summer research.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: N/A
Live virtual lecture with a week of in-person lab sessions.
We also had virtual labs.
